comment._content: Wonderful image, she looks so beautiful and regal.  Thanks for sharing.

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content:
The Sydney Morning Herald critic was suitably impressed by Nellie Stewart and gave her and the production a gushingly glowing review in purple prose, which now reads as camp as the proverbial row of tents. SMH 19/3/1901 p.6 - trove.nla.gov.au/ndp/del/article/14355148
"Miss Stewart was warmly encored for the patriotic song (with chorus) "Australia's Boys," in which her dextrous swordplay was much admired ... ... etc etc"
Happy Mardi Gras!

comment.author: 55198937@N05
comment._content:
State Library has about a dozen online photos of Nellie Stewart, usually in elaborate theatrical costume. Here she is as Mam'zelle Nitouche1895:
